article_title: Tesla Shares Sink on Model 3 Delivery Miss, Price Cuts
short_description: Tesla reported Model 3 sedan deliveries that missed Wall Street’s estimates and said it would cut prices on all its vehicles, news that drove shares of the electric-car maker down nearly 7%.

article_title: Tencent Not Yet Winning Even as China's Game-Approval Freeze Melts
short_description: Regulators ended their freeze on new videogames approvals, though left industry giants Tencent Holdings and NetEase out in the cold when giving the first group the green light.

article_title: Popular Weather App From China Collects Too Much User Data, Security Experts Say
short_description: A weather-forecasting app from TCL Communication Technology Holdings—maker of Alcatel smartphones—asks for data beyond what’s normal for a weather program, a security firm says.

article_title: Trump's Tech Battle With China Roils Bill Gates Nuclear Venture
short_description: Bill Gates said an effort to develop safer and cheaper nuclear reactors at a company he co-founded is now unlikely to proceed because of recent changes in U.S. policy toward China.

article_title: Apple Makes Rare Cut to Sales Forecast
short_description: Apple lowered its sales outlook for its fiscal first quarter, a rare revision to its guidance, blaming slowing sales of smartphones and other devices in China.

article_title: Roku, Taking Cues From Amazon, Adds Premium Subscriptions
short_description: Beginning later this month, Roku will sell subscriptions to premium TV channels such as Starz, Showtime and Epix.

article_title: Canadian Court Slams Uber's Arbitration Process
short_description: Uber lost some of its legal clout with contract drivers in Canada’s largest province after Ontario’s highest court ruled its process for arbitrating disputes were not only unlawful but ‘unconscionable.’

article_title: Listen Up, This Podcast Will Just Take a Minute
short_description: Overwhelmed by the choices, some listeners are loading up podcasts that don’t last much longer than a commercial break.

article_title: Tech That Will Change Your Life in 2019
short_description: An annual roundup of the technology that will affect your life in the year ahead: Mobile 5G will finally make its U.S. debut, providing more reasons than ever to cut the cord, and of course Harry Potter will unite wizards and teach us the true meaning of augmented reality.

article_title: NASA's Spacecraft Zooms Past Ultima Thule
short_description: New Horizons swept past the small celestial object known as Ultima Thule—the first destination to be reached that wasn’t even known until after the mission’s launch.

article_title: Crypto Investors Look for Rebound After Sharp Decline
short_description: Bitcoin slumped about 70% in 2018, erasing $160 billion of digital wealth in a move that exposed the cryptocurrency market’s shaky footing.

article_title: Amazon, to Win in Booming Rural India, Reinvents Itself
short_description: The retailer is targeting hundreds of millions of new online shoppers in India’s countryside by simplifying its order screen with Hindi and videos, opening stores to help people shop and adding a fleet of local deliverymen who can take payments.

article_title: The Future of Everything's 10 Best Stories of 2018
short_description: From a flying-car test drive to the woolly mammoth’s potential return, our favorite stories from the past 12 months.

article_title: Huawei Rivals Nokia and Ericsson Struggle to Capitalize on U.S. Scrutiny
short_description: U.S.-led efforts to curb Huawei should have been good news for telecom-equipment makers Nokia and Ericsson—but things haven’t turned out to be so simple.

article_title: Investor Interest in Chinese Tech Begins 2019 Not With a Bang but a Whimper
short_description: The flood of money rushing into Chinese internet startups has slowed, dashing hopes of quick windfalls for many investors.

article_title: China Pushes for Primacy in Space
short_description: China is poised to realize an ambitious mission to the far side of the moon, the most immediate of many planned milestones in its effort to challenge America’s half-century long supremacy in space.

article_title: Auto Sellers Try Out Amazon-Style Ordering
short_description: More car dealers, as well as startups, are offering direct sales through their websites, as consumers become more comfortable buying big-ticket items online.
